title: Gladitorcomeback
author: Gladitorcomeback
content: Scammer username: Airdrop freeScammers Profile: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3577920Whats happened:I received a telegram notification about a new airdrop claim which is not announced officially yet. I realized something suspicious from the notification. when I opened the thread then my suspicion turned out to be correct. This scammer shared a fake phishing website. The website required wallet connect to claim airdrop. it is clear that it's a scam attempt and by connecting wallet wallet funds will be washed out. I request everyone to tag this scammer and also create a flag to save newbies funds. Account is fully new created and I think he will spam more. Official real website: https://cyberconnect.me/Scam ThreadQuote from: airdrop free on September 13, 2023, 02:40:49 PMREWARD 54 CYBER TOKEN LISTED IN BINANCE ELIGIBILITY ALL MEMBERS WHO MADE ONE TRANSACTION IN BNB CHAIN BEFORE 1 SEPHOW TO CLAIM GOTO OFFICIAL LINK BELOWCode:https://reward-cyber.org/CONNECT YOUR WALLET AND CLAIM YOUR TOKEN. ENJOY[/b]

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on September 13, 2023, 02:59:59 PM... it is clear that it's a scam attempt and by connecting wallet wallet funds will be washed out. I request everyone to tag this scammer and also create a flag to save newbies funds. Why didn't you start it yourself? You haven't tagged the scammer or created the flag. If you are so clear about it, you should have at least tagged him. Asking others to do it without doing it yourself doesn't sound very coherent to me.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on September 13, 2023, 03:14:44 PMWhy didn't you start it yourself?That may be because OP isn't a DT member and thinks that his/her feedback won't be noticed. To OP:If you believe that someone should given a negative trust, leave a negative feedback. Your feedback will be shown as an untrusted feedback, but that's better than nothing and who knows? Some users may add you to their trust list in the future and you may be a DT member one day. You can read the guide provided by LoyceV on how to use the trust system correctly. LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on September 13, 2023, 03:14:44 PMWhy didn't you start it yourself? You haven't tagged the scammer or created the flag. If you are so clear about it, you should have at least tagged him. Asking others to do it without doing it yourself doesn't sound very coherent to me. Actually I was thinking as hosseinimr93 mentioned that my feedback will not appeared on the profile which will not bring good results and my aim is to warn member which is only possible if DT member tag it.Quote from: hosseinimr93 on September 13, 2023, 04:01:30 PMTo OP:If you believe that someone should given a negative trust, leave a negative feedback. Your feedback will be shown as an untrusted feedback, but that's better than nothing and who knows? Some users may add you to their trust list in the future and you may be a DT member one day. You can read the guide provided by LoyceV on how to use the trust system correctly. LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust systemThanks your suggestions are very helpful and I will take care from next time. I have added feedback to the user. Loycev, s guidances are so helpful in this matter.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on September 13, 2023, 05:26:05 PMQuote from: Poker Player on September 13, 2023, 03:14:44 PMWhy didn't you start it yourself? You haven't tagged the scammer or created the flag. If you are so clear about it, you should have at least tagged him. Asking others to do it without doing it yourself doesn't sound very coherent to me. Actually I was thinking as hosseinimr93 mentioned that my feedback will not appeared on the profile which will not bring good results and my aim is to warn member which is only possible if DT member tag it.Regardless of your DT status, here I encourage you to start tagging accounts when you are sure they are scams. Over time, if it turns out that your assessments are good, you will quickly reach at least the DT2 list. So, based on your trust/distrust list and the feedback you leave, others can better evaluate you.In such scam accusations, always notice that you tagged that user and that (if) you possibly created the tag.note: I am going to tag the account mentioned from OP to be visible.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on September 13, 2023, 05:26:05 PMActually I was thinking as hosseinimr93 mentioned that my feedback will not appeared on the profile which will not bring good results and my aim is to warn member which is only possible if DT member tag it.From now on, it is better if you do as hosseinimr93 and examples suggested and as I can see you have already done in this case. I just noticed that the airdrop free thread has disappeared. I don't know if he deleted it or for some reason he has been banned. It should be the former because scams are not moderated. I guess it was when he saw the tags and this thread.

comments.author: albon
comments.created_time: September 14, 2023, 08:10:12 PMLast edit: September 14, 2023, 08:20:39 PM by albon
comments.body: Thank you, OP, for this thread.He created a topic again today for the same phishing link after his first topic was deleted. He is now asking the bounty hunters to connect their wallets and approve sign messages in order to receive five stakes per week to be eligible for $5,000 cyber coins. This is a lie, and I hope that none of the hunters believe this scammer and do what he asks of them.Link to his new scam topic: [Escrow] 5000 Cyber Bounty Limited  | Archived--------Quote from: airdrop free on September 14, 2023, 02:46:25 PMFUCK YOU ALL. WHY TAG ME? Be polite.Your question you know the answer to very well. You are trying to spread your scam schemes here to steal innocent people. This forum has good members who will try to stop you and sabotage what you are doing, so step back from what you are doing.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: albon on September 14, 2023, 08:10:12 PMBe polite.Your question you know the answer to very well. You are trying to spread your scam schemes here to steal innocent people. This forum has good members who will try to stop you and sabotage what you are doing, so step back from what you are doing.What's the point of him being polite? It's obvious that he's already aware of what he's doing and has seen that he has been caught in the act, but he did not expect a quick response from members here on the forum.It just keeps on suppressing me how some scammers do think that they can come to a crypto forum as big as Bitcoin Talk and just post any link and don't expect anyone to investigate what's truly behind that link; they don't really think straight on their mode of scam attempt.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on September 14, 2023, 01:51:54 PMI just noticed that the airdrop free thread has disappeared. I don't know if he deleted it or for some reason he has been banned. It should be the former because scams are not moderated. I guess it was when he saw the tags and this thread.Scams aren't moderated, but posts (or threads) spamming links to phishing sites are often deleted by mods.  I've reported plenty of threads and posts for that reason, and have yet to see one not get deleted.  I don't know if that's what happened to this scammer's thread, though.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on September 14, 2023, 01:51:54 PMI just noticed that the airdrop free thread has disappeared. I don't know if he deleted it or for some reason he has been banned. It should be the former because scams are not moderated. I guess it was when he saw the tags and this thread.Since the topic deletion has been recorded in the modlog, it has been deleted by moderators, not the user. Deletion logThe user has not been banned. Of course, as temporary bans are not recorded in the modlog, it's possible that the user has been banned temporarily.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: The user @Airdrop free again started advertising scam link and one user post POA in the thread, If anyone connected wallet then his wallet will be empty. Is there any way to completely ban this user because he is continuesly spamming despite of negative tag and deletion of thread many times. Quote from: hosseinimr93 on September 14, 2023, 09:55:51 PMThe user has not been banned. Of course, as temporary bans are not recorded in the modlog, it's possible that the user has been banned temporarily. You are right, now he again able to post. Moderator should take this matter seriously.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on September 24, 2023, 02:19:11 PMThe user @Airdrop free again started advertising scam link and one user post POA in the thread, If anyone connected wallet then his wallet will be empty. Is there any way to completely ban this user because he is continuesly spamming despite of negative tag and deletion of thread many times. I saw that the @Airdrop free account was active today. His posts may be deleted by the moderator, it doesn't mean he will stop his activity, he will resume his activity when he gets another chance. This user should be banned to keep the forum clean so that he can't promote this kind of phishing link in the forum again. Because we have seen many such members in the past who came to the forum and promoted various scams and ended their activities by getting banned. This user will continue such activities until he is banned.
